question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [zkless Feature Gate Race] At lines 172-176, can a race condition between feature flag updates and transaction validation allow zkless keyless transactions to be processed when the feature is being disabled? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Passkey Feature Gate Bypass] Can the WebAuthn signature check at lines 177-181 be bypassed by wrapping the signature in a different EphemeralSignature variant while still using passkey functionality? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Federated Keyless Gate Bypass] Can an attacker use a Normal keyless public key that secretly behaves like a Federated one to bypass the feature gate at lines 182-186? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Mixed Authenticator Attack] If a transaction contains both ZK and non-ZK authenticators, can the with_zk flag logic at lines 162-170 be exploited to skip validation of some authenticators? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [PVK Null Pointer] At line 190, if with_zk is true but pvk.is_none(), validation fails - but can an attacker race this check by having PVK set initially then removed during validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Configuration Deserialization] Can the configuration.ok_or_else at line 194 be bypassed if Configuration fetch succeeds but returns invalid/malicious configuration data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Signature Count Overflow] At line 203, authenticators.len() is compared to max_signatures_per_txn as usize - can integer overflow in the cast allow more signatures than intended? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Early Expiry Check Bypass] The redundant expiry check at lines 212-219 is meant to fail fast - but if this check passes and the later check in verify_keyless_signature fails, could there be inconsistent state? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Timestamp Fetch TOCTOU] Between get_current_time_onchain at line 208 and the expiry checks, could the on-chain time be updated, causing validators to have different validation results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/keyless_validation.rs] [Function: validate_authenticators()] [Federated JWK Fallback Logic] At lines 237-261, the fallback logic tries 0x1 first then federated - can an attacker exploit this ordering to use expired/revoked JWKs from 0x1 even when federated JWKs are fresher?
